definition: category/genus (taxonomy)/family members/dependents/to belong to/subordinate to/affiliated with/be born in the year of (one of the 12 animals)/to be/to prove to be/to constitute
to join together/to fix one's attention on/to concentrate on
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/just a handful/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
to reveal one's talent (idiom)/to rise above others/to distinguish oneself
to force one's way out of encirclement/to break through
anyone with eyes can see it (idiom); obvious to all/sth speaks for itself/is there for all to see
worthy of pride/impressive/enviable/to show contempt for others
